xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This work was supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grant No. 60972098, the Natural Science Foundation of Hubei province of China under Grant No. 2009CDB075, and the Opening Research Foundation of the Key Laboratory of Education Ministry of China for Image Processing and Intelligent Control under Grant No. 200801. The authors would like to thank Dr. M. E. Celebi of the Department of Computer Science, Louisiana State University in Shreveport, for kindly providing the run program of RSVMF, and the anonymous reviewers for their valuable querys and careful correcting the English errors which helped to improve the paper.

head.citation-title: Quaternion-based color image filtering for impulsive noise suppression
head.abstracts: It is difficult to precisely detect all impulsive noise in color images due to the nonstationarity caused by edges and fine details. For many pixels, we can not absolutely classify them as noisy or noise-free, but can only describe them using the likelihood that they are corrupted by impulsive noise. Based on this consideration, we present a new filtering solution to removing impulsive noise from color images. The proposed method first utilizes the unit transforms of quaternions to represent the chromaticity difference of two color pixels, and then divides the image into noise-free and possible noisy pixels. Finally it performs adaptive weighted vector median filtering operations on only the possible noisy pixels to suppress noise. The new weighting mechanism is based on a joint spatial/quaternionchromaticity criterion, which ensures that pixels with different contamination likelihoods have different contributions to the filter's output. The extensive simulation results indicate that the proposed method significantly outperforms some other well-known multichannel filtering techniques. © 2010 SPIE and IS&T.

organization.$: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
School of Computer Science and Technology

coredata.dc:description: It is difficult to precisely detect all impulsive noise in color images due to the nonstationarity caused by edges and fine details. For many pixels, we can not absolutely classify them as noisy or noise-free, but can only describe them using the likelihood that they are corrupted by impulsive noise. Based on this consideration, we present a new filtering solution to removing impulsive noise from color images. The proposed method first utilizes the unit transforms of quaternions to represent the chromaticity difference of two color pixels, and then divides the image into noise-free and possible noisy pixels. Finally it performs adaptive weighted vector median filtering operations on only the possible noisy pixels to suppress noise. The new weighting mechanism is based on a joint spatial/quaternionchromaticity criterion, which ensures that pixels with different contamination likelihoods have different contributions to the filter's output. The extensive simulation results indicate that the proposed method significantly outperforms some other well-known multichannel filtering techniques. © 2010 SPIE and IS&T.
